Html:
Thanks a lot for GMap.NET, it saves me many hours of coding.
But there is one thing I cannot find out how to achieve and that is printing (or saving as an image) of the selectedArea.
The DrawToBitmap() saves the whole client area of the control. The properties of the selectedArea seem to provide Lat/Lon info, but I could not find a way to translate this into a workable format to just print the selection.
Is there any info on this, or can anybody help me out?
Thanks very much for any help!

Thank you radioman!
The demo example is clear and helpful, but it deals with downloading the needed map tiles.
What I actually was looking for, was much more simple, a kind of screenshot, but using the selected area of the gmap control. Resolution is not important. If the selectedArea would expose a method DrawToBitmap(), that would be great!
Thanks for any suggestions!

Hello Antonio
            Dim img As Image = Me.MainMap.ToImage
            Dim _frm_screenshot As New frm_screenshot(img)
            _frm_screenshot.Show()
and in this form i do several things with the Image(Save, Resize, North Arrow, ...)
pretty fast and easy

static map is usefull for plotting an area on A0 or sth like that.
Bye Ede
